key_risks: Dependence on government contracts leading to vulnerability to budget cuts, political shifts, and delays in contract awards
Intense competition in the consulting and technology sectors
Regulatory changes impacting demand for services, particularly in sustainability and climate change consulting
controversies: Legal disputes such as Dorothy Buchhagen v. ICF International, Inc., highlighting risks related to contract transitions and employment disputes
Potential ethical controversies related to conflicts of interest, data privacy, and transparency
environmental_issues: Need to comply with evolving environmental regulations and support clients in achieving net-zero carbon goals
social_issues: Data privacy concerns and the need to maintain client trust
governance_issues: Navigating potential conflicts of interest as a government contractor
Ensuring compliance with applicable laws and maintaining transparency

sources.title: Utah Business Contract Disputes | Provo Business Attorneys
sources.snippet: A business contract dispute occurs when one or more parties involved in a contract have a disagreement over the terms of the contract or its execution. In Utah, as in other states, these disputes can take many forms, including disputes over service delivery, payment terms, confidentiality agreements, and non-compete clauses, among others.
